title: Rocket Report: Feds assess Starship fallout; Sweden accidentally bombs Norway
summary: "It is crucial that those responsible immediately inform the relevant Norwegian authorities."

title: China to establish organization to coordinate international moon base
summary: China National Space Administration will soon set up an organization to oversee and coordinate the China-led International Lunar Research Station.

title: Nelson expects SpaceX to be ready for next Starship launch within months
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson told a House committee that SpaceX’s truncated Starship test flight was not a major setback in plans to use that vehicle to land astronauts on the moon as soon as 2025.

title: How Chang Zheng 9 arrived at the “Starship-like” design
summary: China has been very agile in developing its super-heavy lift vehicle Chang Zheng 9 (CZ-9). It initially started as a fully expendable rocket, like the Ares V or SLS rockets, but over the years developed into at first a partially reusable concept, and recently, with Starship becoming more real, it changed its design again to become a fully reusable launch vehicle. Today we want to look at the road to that design.

title: Russia commits to ISS extension to 2028
summary: The Russian government has agreed to continue participation in the International Space Station to at least 2028, the last partner to agree to an extension of the station’s operations.
